column4: hello guys. I was having problems with getting the boot-disk to work, and someone pointed me to https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SmartBootManagerHowto . That page tells me "Then use rawrite command: rawrite -f sbm.bin (rawwritewin.exe sbm.bin)" but to me it's a little unclear where exactly to enter that command -- > using Windows ME and trying to get a bootdisk of Ubuntu6.06LTS to work
(btw, cmd did not work here in the run, but command did, maybe usefull to add that to the guide)
type the command in the command prompt
s: the command is returned as invalid
cd [directory where rawwritewin.exe is located] replace that
then rerun that command
did yoou type what i said literally or did you replace it by what i told you to replace it with
dir
although as rawwri~1.exe
type that exactly then
btw u should scrap ME its too old
still doesn't work :S
what i typed now in the correct folder is: rawrite -f sbm.bin (rawwri~1.exe sbm.bin)
nope
is there anything that might be wrong?
remove the other linux command
just say rawwri~1.exe sbm.bin
that is doing something :)
looks like the guide needs a clarification
btw u should scrap ME its too old
it certainly does :)
note that the cmd in >run> did not even work here, i had to use command
wtf, it just works!
